title: Autopilot servo actuator can be represented in simplified fo…
caption_en: Autopilot servo actuator can be represented in simplified form as shown above.

title: When the servo is denergised, the clutch is open and the spl…
caption_en: When the servo is denergised, the clutch is open and the spline is free to rotate. In the energised condition, servo clutch is close and the spline is driven directly by the electric motor.

title: The pitch and roll servos are connected to the autopilot cir…
caption_en: The pitch and roll servos are connected to the autopilot circuit card which resides in IC-600 2 computer.

title: The spline of the servo is linked to flight control surfaces…
caption_en: The spline of the servo is linked to flight control surfaces via mechanical and cable linkages. The roll and pitch servos are connected to the aileron and elevator respectively.

title: For AP to steer the aircraft, it must receive steering guida…
caption_en: For AP to steer the aircraft, it must receive steering guidance. The steering guidance is provided by the left or right flight director depending on which is selected as the master. The master FD is determined by the transfer button. Pushing this button toggles the green arrow left or right. Where the arrow is pointing at, that side of the FD is selected as the master.

title: Steering guidance to the AP system can also be provided by t…
caption_en: Steering guidance to the AP system can also be provided by the control wheel trim switch located on the outboard side of each control wheel. Actuating the trim switch without pressing the arming button provide manual input by the crew to manoeuvre the aircraft. However, this way of manoeuvring the aircraft is available only on the coupled or master side.

title: When the steering signals are present and provided AP is eng…
caption_en: When the steering signals are present and provided AP is engaged, the servos will respond to the command signals and move the control surfaces accordingly.

title: The AP trims the aircraft in the pitch axis by moving the ho…
caption_en: The AP trims the aircraft in the pitch axis by moving the horizontal stabilizer updown using secondary pitch trim actuator. When the AP energises the secondary trim actuator for more than 2 to 3 seconds, a series of audible Clacker sounds is transmitted through the audio system.

title: The purpose of pitch trimming by the horizontal stabilizer i…
caption_en: The purpose of pitch trimming by the horizontal stabilizer is to reduce air load on the elevator following a manoeuvre of elevator causing a change in pitch attitude. In a trimmed condition the pitch servo is relieved of torque exerted due to the presence of current.

title: For pitch trimming to function, the pitch trim selector, whi…
caption_en: For pitch trimming to function, the pitch trim selector, which is on centre pedestal, must not be in OFF position. In the OFF position, AP will not engage.

title: With the pitch switch in either PRI (primary) or SEC (second…
caption_en: With the pitch switch in either PRI (primary) or SEC (secondary) position, power from the right essential bus is supplied to secondary pitch trim actuator.

title: If the trim malfunction has occurred, and the trim system ha…
caption_en: If the trim malfunction has occurred, and the trim system has not sufficiently reduced elevator servo current, a white "AP ELEV MISTRIM message will be displayed on the CAS to indicate torque is still exerted by the elevator servo on the control surface.

title: If the mistrim continues (more than 10 seconds), or current …
caption_en: If the mistrim continues (more than 10 seconds), or current drawn by the pitch servo is excessive, the message will turn from white to amber. The annunciation informs the crew that the aircraft is out of trim and that a disconnect, while out of trim, can cause a slight manoeuvre.

title: In this case it will also be necessary for the crew to corre…
caption_en: In this case it will also be necessary for the crew to correct the mistrim condition

title: The yaw servo receives input from either the yaw damper or r…
caption_en: The yaw servo receives input from either the yaw damper or rudder boost system. The servo is connected to the rudder control surface.

title: The yaw damper system provides yaw damping and turn co-ordin…
caption_en: The yaw damper system provides yaw damping and turn co-ordination functions. It makes no effort to control the flightpath of the airplane. YD recieves yaw information from attitude and heading reference systems (AHRS)

title: Rudder boost system is installed to assist crew when heavy r…
caption_en: Rudder boost system is installed to assist crew when heavy rudder pedal force is reqiured to maintain control, such as with engine failure during takeoff. This topic is discussed in Flight Control chapter.

title: The yaw damper can be engaged independent of the autopilot b…
caption_en: The yaw damper can be engaged independent of the autopilot but the autopilot cannot be engaged without the yaw damper.

title: On power-up, the APYD systems perform a self-test on the ser…
caption_en: On power-up, the APYD systems perform a self-test on the servo circuits and the control and disconnect paths. During the self-test, AP TEST is annunciated in amber above the centre portion of ADI.

title: The self-test last for as long as the AHR Ss initialisation …
caption_en: The self-test last for as long as the AHR Ss initialisation is taking place. Watch

title: At the very top, centre section of the PFDs is a field dedic…
caption_en: At the very top, centre section of the PFDs is a field dedicated to flight director and AP annunciation.

title: A horizontal arrow appears at the top, centre of each betwee…
caption_en: A horizontal arrow appears at the top, centre of each between the flight director roll and pitch mode annuciators.

title: This arrow points left or right, as selected on the switch, …
caption_en: This arrow points left or right, as selected on the switch, to indicate 1) which fight director is the master, and 2) the flight director in which AP will couple to when it is engaged.

title: This arrow points left or right, as selected on the switch, …
caption_en: This arrow points left or right, as selected on the switch, to indicate 1) which fight director is the master, and 2) the flight director in which AP will couple to when it is engaged. The arrow on the is a repeater of the green arrows on either side of the switch

title: Just below the arrow is a line reserved for AP and YD annunc…
caption_en: Just below the arrow is a line reserved for AP and YD annunciation. A green "AP" and appear in this area on the when AP andor YD isare engaged.

title: The button has an arrowhead on each side. The system default…
caption_en: The button has an arrowhead on each side. The system defaults to the pilot's side on power-up illuminating the left arrow in green. This means that the left flight director is the master.

title: After power-up, each time the button is depressed, the arrow…
caption_en: After power-up, each time the button is depressed, the arrow head toggles to the opposite side. Touch the button.

title: After power-up, each time the button is depressed, the arrow…
caption_en: After power-up, each time the button is depressed, the arrow head toggles to the opposite side.

title: The change in arrow head direction on the switch is also acc…
caption_en: The change in arrow head direction on the switch is also accompanied by the change in direction of the arrow on the The arrow should normally be pointing to the side from which the airplane is being flown.

title: However, when is selected with AP engaged, any flight direct…
caption_en: However, when is selected with AP engaged, any flight director modes that were engaged will be cancelled on the PFDs. Watch

title: The arrow changes direction, but the flight director modes r…
caption_en: The arrow changes direction, but the flight director modes revert to basic modes: ROL and PIT. The AP remains engaged.

title: If the flight director modes have been selected with autopil…
caption_en: If the flight director modes have been selected with autopilot not engaged and the transfer button is pushed, it will cancel all flight director modes on the PFDs. Watch

title: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, it…
caption_en: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, itis a good practice to a) decide first which flight director is to be the master,

title: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, it…
caption_en: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, itis a good practice to a) decide first which flight director is to be the master, b) select button arrow to the master side,

title: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, it…
caption_en: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, itis a good practice to a) decide first which flight director is to be the master, b) select button arrow to the master side, c) select flight director modes.

title: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, it…
caption_en: Therefore, to avoid reselection of flight director modes, itis a good practice to a) decide first which flight director is to be the master, b) select button arrow to the master side, c) select flight director modes. d) engage AP.

title: The AP and YD are engaged using AP and YD select buttons loc…
caption_en: The AP and YD are engaged using AP and YD select buttons located on the centre section of the Each button has a vertical green bar that illuminates when engaged.

title: When the AP button is depressed, engaging the AP, the YD wil…
caption_en: When the AP button is depressed, engaging the AP, the YD will also engage, if not previously selected. Touch the AP button.

title: When the AP button is depressed, engaging the AP, the YD wil…
caption_en: When the AP button is depressed, engaging the AP, the YD will also engage, if not previously selected.

title: The YD can be engaged independently of the AP, but the AP sy…
caption_en: The YD can be engaged independently of the AP, but the AP system will not engage without the

title: The AP can be engaged with bank angles up to 45 and pitch at…
caption_en: The AP can be engaged with bank angles up to 45 and pitch attitudes between

title: If the AP is engaged with the bank angle exceeding 30 which …
caption_en: If the AP is engaged with the bank angle exceeding 30 which is the maximun limit for AP operation in the basic roll mode, AP will return airplane roll

title: Likewise, engaging AP with airplane pitch attitudes outside …
caption_en: Likewise, engaging AP with airplane pitch attitudes outside the normal envelope will cause AP to limit airplane pitch limits to 20 to as shown in the graphics.

title: When the AP is engaged with no FD modes engaged and the roll…
caption_en: When the AP is engaged with no FD modes engaged and the roll attitude is within 6 of wings level, the AP will roll the airplane to wings level attitude and hold the existing pitch. This mode is referred to as the heading hold mode, and will be annunciated on the with "ROL" appearing in the FD roll mode field and "PIT" in the pitch mode.

title: If the bank angle is greater than 6 when the AP is engaged, …
caption_en: If the bank angle is greater than 6 when the AP is engaged, and with no FD modes active the AP holds the airplane in the existing bank and pitch attitude. The FD command bars will also sync to the existing attitude and the ROL and PIT are annunciated. This is referred to as roll hold mode.

title: When the AP is engaged, the command bars and the FD modes on…
caption_en: When the AP is engaged, the command bars and the FD modes on the master cannot be removed by pressing the corresponding FD switch. The above graphics indicate pilot's flight director is the master and therefore the

title: However, the command bars and the FD modes on the slave can …
caption_en: However, the command bars and the FD modes on the slave can be removed by pressing its FD switch. This switch toggles the bars and FD modes on and off. Touch FD 2 switch.

title: If any flight director modes are selected before the AP is e…
caption_en: If any flight director modes are selected before the AP is engaged, the AP automatically couples to the selected FD modes.

title: To fly the airplane manually through the AP system, AP must …
caption_en: To fly the airplane manually through the AP system, AP must be engaged without any FD modes. When the AP is engaged, ROL and PIT will annunciate in basic on the roll and pitch modes respectively. In the basic modes, crew would be able to input steering signals through the without pressing the arming button.

title: Moving the control wheel trim switch updown, without depress…
caption_en: Moving the control wheel trim switch updown, without depressing the arming button, provides direct pitch signal to the pitch servo through the AP.

title: Similarly, leftiright movement on the control wheel trim swi…
caption_en: Similarly, leftiright movement on the control wheel trim switch will provide roll signal to the roll servo.

title: If the arming button is depressed and the control wheel trim…
caption_en: If the arming button is depressed and the control wheel trim switch is moved in any direction, the AP will be disengaged. Watch.

title: The YD is not affected in this case; it remains engaged.
caption_en: The YD is not affected in this case; it remains engaged.

title: If AP is engaged with FD modes already selected, moving the …
caption_en: If AP is engaged with FD modes already selected, moving the control wheel trim switch left and right without pressing the arming button will trip the selected FD roll mode and revert the mode to basic ROL mode.

title: Likewise, moving the control wheel trim switch updown withou…
caption_en: Likewise, moving the control wheel trim switch updown without pressing the arming button will cause the selected pitch mode to trip and revert the pitch mode to basic "PIT".

title: Moving the control wheel trim switch leftiright and updown w…
caption_en: Moving the control wheel trim switch leftiright and updown will not disengage the roll and pitch modes if APP button is engaged and LOC and GS are captured. Manual AP control is ineffective under this condition.

title: Touch control steering switch, located at each inboard contr…
caption_en: Touch control steering switch, located at each inboard control wheel, is used to temporarily take control from the AP when itis engaged. It can also be used as a FD pitch or roll sync switch when AP is disengaged.

title: With AP engaged, depressing and holding EITHER button diseng…
caption_en: With AP engaged, depressing and holding EITHER button disengages the clutch on the pitch and roll servos. In this condition, the servos splines are free to rotate and the crew can now manoeuvre the airplane through the control column without disengaging the AP.

title: While the button is held depressed, a white annunciator appe…
caption_en: While the button is held depressed, a white annunciator appears in the AP display area at the top of PFDs.

title: In addition, selected FD modes remain engaged and the comman…
caption_en: In addition, selected FD modes remain engaged and the command bars synchronize to the existing airplane attitude.

title: Once released, the pitch and roll clutch servos re-engage an…
caption_en: Once released, the pitch and roll clutch servos re-engage and give airplane control back to the AP. Previously engaged vertical modes (Speed, Vertical Speed or Altitude) will synchronise to the new existing flight conditions and lateral modes will attempt to recapture. This will be dealt with in the flight director section.

title: Depressing the arming button on either and momentarily movin…
caption_en: Depressing the arming button on either and momentarily moving the in any direction. This is the normal way of disengaging the AP.

title: Momentarily depressing either control wheel master switch ju…
caption_en: Momentarily depressing either control wheel master switch just below This will also disengage

title: Depressing the AP or YD button
caption_en: Depressing the AP or YD button

title: Turning the trim selector switch off
caption_en: Turning the trim selector switch off

title: Turning the trim selector switch off -- Activating the secon…
caption_en: Turning the trim selector switch off -- Activating the secondary trim switch with PITCH TRIM selector in SEC

title: Depressing the go-around (GA) button on the left thrust leve…
caption_en: Depressing the go-around (GA) button on the left thrust lever.

title: When the AP is disengaged by any the above, a disconnect ton…
caption_en: When the AP is disengaged by any the above, a disconnect tone, similar to the first few notes of cavalry charge, momentarily sounds.

title: At the same time, the green AP on the turn amber and flash f…
caption_en: At the same time, the green AP on the turn amber and flash for 5 seconds, then blank. Additionally, the green bar light within the AP select button on the extinguishes.

title: Yaw damper can be disengaged by any one of the following: --…
caption_en: Yaw damper can be disengaged by any one of the following: -- Pushing the YD button on the

title: Yaw damper can be disengaged by any one of the following: --…
caption_en: Yaw damper can be disengaged by any one of the following: -- Pushing the YD button on the -- Pushing either

title: There is no aural warning accompanying YD disengagement. The…
caption_en: There is no aural warning accompanying YD disengagement. The YD annunciation on the flashes amber for 5 seconds and then disappears. The YD green bar extinguishes.

title: If the AP is also engaged, it too will disengage along with …
caption_en: If the AP is also engaged, it too will disengage along with the in which case, cavalry charge is also heard.

title: But there are occassions in which APYD may disengage automat…
caption_en: But there are occassions in which APYD may disengage automatically for any of the following reasons:

title: Slide 75
Slide 76
Slide 77
Slide 78
Slide 79
If AP disconnect is due to any of the reasons mentioned, the…
caption_en: If AP disconnect is due to any of the reasons mentioned, the cavalry charge will sound continuously. The AP annuciation becomes steady red on the

title: Momentarily depressing the switch for at least 2 seconds ack…
caption_en: Momentarily depressing the switch for at least 2 seconds acknowledges the monitor disconnect and silences the cavalry charge. If the system resets, the red AP annunciator on the is removed.

title: If the system fails to reset, the AP will remain steady in r…
caption_en: If the system fails to reset, the AP will remain steady in red or amber. The pilots will have to refer to the checklist for procedures.

title: If the YD is also disconnected by any of the reasons mention…
caption_en: If the YD is also disconnected by any of the reasons mentioned, amber YD is annunciated on the until is depressed for at least 2 seconds. If the amber YD remains, crew will have to refer to checklist.
